groupColumns.label: Games Played
groupColumns.description: Games in which a player has appeared.

groupColumns.label: At Bats
groupColumns.description: Trips to the plate that do not result in a walk, hit by pitch, sacrifice, or reach on interference.

groupColumns.label: Runs
groupColumns.description: When a baserunner safely reaches home plate and scores.

groupColumns.label: Hits
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches base safely on a fair ball unless the batter is deemed by the official scorer to have reached on an error or a fielder's choice.

groupColumns.label: Doubles
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit and stops at second base or only advances farther than second base on an error or a fielder's attempt to put out another baserunner.

groupColumns.label: Triples
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit and stops at third base or only advances farther than third base on an error or a fielder's attempt to put out another baserunner.

groupColumns.label: Home Runs
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit, touches all bases, and scores a run without a putout recorded or the benefit of error.

groupColumns.label: Runs Batted In
groupColumns.description: Runs which score because of the batter's safe hit, sac bunt, sac fly, infield out or fielder's choice or is forced to score by a bases loaded walk, hit batter, or interference.

groupColumns.label: Walks
groupColumns.description: When a batter is awarded first base after four balls have been called by the umpire or the opposing team opts to intentionally award the batter first base.

groupColumns.label: Strikeouts
groupColumns.description: When the umpire calls three strikes on the batter.

groupColumns.label: Stolen Bases
groupColumns.description: When the runner advances one base unaided by a hit, a putout, an error, a force-out, a fielder's choice, a passed ball, a wild pitch, or a balk.

groupColumns.label: Caught Stealing
groupColumns.description: When a runner attempts to steal but is tagged out before safely attaining the next base.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average
groupColumns.description: The rate of hits per at bat.

groupColumns.label: On-Base Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter reached base in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: Slugging Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate of total bases per at bat.

groupColumns.label: On-Base Plus Slugging
groupColumns.description: The sum of on-base percentage and slugging percentage.

groupColumns.label: Plate Appearances
groupColumns.description: The number of times a player has taken his turn at bat.

groupColumns.label: Hit-by-Pitch
groupColumns.description: When a batter is struck by a pitched ball which he is not attempting to hit and is awarded first base by the umpire.

groupColumns.label: Sacrifice Bunts
groupColumns.description: When a batter advances one or more runners at least one base with a bunt.

groupColumns.label: Sacrifice Flies
groupColumns.description: When a batter hits a fly ball to the outfield that is caught and a runner scores.

groupColumns.label: Ground Into Double Play
groupColumns.description: When a player hits a ground ball that results in more than one out on the bases.

groupColumns.label: Groundout to Air Out Ratio
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of groundouts to air outs.

groupColumns.label: Extra Base Hits
groupColumns.description: Total hits that were not singles.

groupColumns.label: Total Bases
groupColumns.description: The total number of bases gained by a batter through his hits.

groupColumns.label: Intentional Walks
groupColumns.description: The number of times a batter was intentionally walked.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average on Balls in Play
groupColumns.description: A measure of a player's batting average exclusively on balls hit into the field of play, removing outcomes not affected by the opposing defense (namely home runs and strikeouts).

groupColumns.label: Isolated Power
groupColumns.description: The raw power of a hitter, measured as the rate of extra bases per at bat.

groupColumns.label: At Bats per Home Run
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of at bats to home runs.

groupColumns.label: Walk to Strikeout Rate
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of walks to strikeouts.

groupColumns.label: Walk Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter walks in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: Strikeout Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter strikes out in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: On-Base Plus Slugging
groupColumns.description: The sum of on-base percentage and slugging percentage.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average
groupColumns.description: The rate of hits per at bat.

groupColumns.label: Home Runs
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit, touches all bases, and scores a run without a putout recorded or the benefit of error.

groupColumns.label: Runs Batted In
groupColumns.description: Runs which score because of the batter's safe hit, sac bunt, sac fly, infield out or fielder's choice or is forced to score by a bases loaded walk, hit batter, or interference.

groupColumns.label: Runs
groupColumns.description: When a baserunner safely reaches home plate and scores.

groupColumns.label: Hits
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches base safely on a fair ball unless the batter is deemed by the official scorer to have reached on an error or a fielder's choice.

groupColumns.label: Doubles
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit and stops at second base or only advances farther than second base on an error or a fielder's attempt to put out another baserunner.

groupColumns.label: Triples
groupColumns.description: When a batter reaches on a hit and stops at third base or only advances farther than third base on an error or a fielder's attempt to put out another baserunner.

groupColumns.label: Games Played
groupColumns.description: Games in which a player has appeared.

groupColumns.label: At Bats
groupColumns.description: Trips to the plate that do not result in a walk, hit by pitch, sacrifice, or reach on interference.

groupColumns.label: Walks
groupColumns.description: When a batter is awarded first base after four balls have been called by the umpire or the opposing team opts to intentionally award the batter first base.

groupColumns.label: Strikeouts
groupColumns.description: When the umpire calls three strikes on the batter.

groupColumns.label: Stolen Bases
groupColumns.description: When the runner advances one base unaided by a hit, a putout, an error, a force-out, a fielder's choice, a passed ball, a wild pitch, or a balk.

groupColumns.label: Caught Stealing
groupColumns.description: When a runner attempts to steal but is tagged out before safely attaining the next base.

groupColumns.label: On-Base Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter reached base in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: Slugging Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate of total bases per at bat.

groupColumns.label: Plate Appearances
groupColumns.description: The number of times a player has taken his turn at bat.

groupColumns.label: Hit-by-Pitch
groupColumns.description: When a batter is struck by a pitched ball which he is not attempting to hit and is awarded first base by the umpire.

groupColumns.label: Sacrifice Bunts
groupColumns.description: When a batter advances one or more runners at least one base with a bunt.

groupColumns.label: Sacrifice Flies
groupColumns.description: When a batter hits a fly ball to the outfield that is caught and a runner scores.

groupColumns.label: Ground Into Double Play
groupColumns.description: When a player hits a ground ball that results in more than one out on the bases.

groupColumns.label: Groundout to Air Out Ratio
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of groundouts to air outs.

groupColumns.label: Extra Base Hits
groupColumns.description: Total hits that were not singles.

groupColumns.label: Total Bases
groupColumns.description: The total number of bases gained by a batter through his hits.

groupColumns.label: Intentional Walks
groupColumns.description: The number of times a batter was intentionally walked.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average on Balls in Play
groupColumns.description: A measure of a player's batting average exclusively on balls hit into the field of play, removing outcomes not affected by the opposing defense (namely home runs and strikeouts).

groupColumns.label: Isolated Power
groupColumns.description: The raw power of a hitter, measured as the rate of extra bases per at bat.

groupColumns.label: At Bats per Home Run
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of at bats to home runs.

groupColumns.label: Walk to Strikeout Rate
groupColumns.description: A batter's ratio of walks to strikeouts.

groupColumns.label: Walk Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter walks in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: Strikeout Percentage
groupColumns.description: The rate at which a batter strikes out in his plate appearances.

groupColumns.label: Wins
groupColumns.description: Credited to the pitcher whose team assumes a lead while such pitcher is in the game and does not relinquish such lead unless otherwise assigned by the official scorer.

groupColumns.label: Losses
groupColumns.description: Credited to the pitcher in the game when his team relinquishes — and never regains — the lead.

groupColumns.label: Earned Run Average
groupColumns.description: The average number of earned runs a pitcher allows per 9 innings.

groupColumns.label: Games
groupColumns.description: Games in which the pitcher threw at least one pitch.

groupColumns.label: Games Started
groupColumns.description: Games started by the pitcher, as defined by who threw the first pitch for their team.

groupColumns.label: Complete Games
groupColumns.description: When a pitcher starts and finishes the entire game without relief.

groupColumns.label: Shutouts
groupColumns.description: When a pitcher throws a complete game and allows no runs.

groupColumns.label: Saves
groupColumns.description: Awarded to the relief pitcher who finishes a game for the winning team, under certain circumstances.

groupColumns.label: Save Opportunities
groupColumns.description: Appearances in which a pitcher enters the game with a chance to earn a save.

groupColumns.label: Innings Pitched
groupColumns.description: Number of putouts recorded while the pitcher was on the mound, divided by three, with .1 representing 1/3 of an inning and .2 representing 2/3.

groupColumns.label: Hits
groupColumns.description: Hits allowed by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Runs
groupColumns.description: Runs allowed by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Earned Runs
groupColumns.description: Earned runs allowed by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Home Runs
groupColumns.description: Home runs allowed by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Hit Batsmen
groupColumns.description: When a batter is struck by a pitched ball which he is not attempting to hit.

groupColumns.label: Walks
groupColumns.description: Walks allowed by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Strikeouts
groupColumns.description: When a pitcher throws any combination of three swinging or looking strikes to a hitter.

groupColumns.label: Walks and Hits Per Inning Pitched
groupColumns.description: The ratio of walks plus hits to innings pitched.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average Against
groupColumns.description: The rate of hits per at bat against a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Total Batters Faced
groupColumns.description: Total number of batters faced by a pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Number of Pitches
groupColumns.description: Total number of pitches thrown.

groupColumns.label: Pitches per Inning
groupColumns.description: Average number of pitches thrown per inning.

groupColumns.label: Quality Starts
groupColumns.description: Credited to a starting pitcher who pitches at least six innings and allows three earned runs or fewer.

groupColumns.label: Games Finished
groupColumns.description: Credited to the pitcher who is last to pitch for his team in a given game, provided he was not the starting pitcher.

groupColumns.label: Holds
groupColumns.description: When a relief pitcher enters the game in a save situation and maintains his team's lead for the next relief pitcher, while recording at least one out.

groupColumns.label: Intentional Walks
groupColumns.description: When a pitcher or pitcher's manager elects to award the batter first base rather than pitching to him.

groupColumns.label: Wild Pitches
groupColumns.description: A pitch so high, wide, or low that the catcher does not stop and control the ball by ordinary effort, thereby permitting a runner or runners to advance.

groupColumns.label: Balks
groupColumns.description: An illegal act by a pitcher when one or more runners are on base, resulting in the advancement of each baserunner.

groupColumns.label: Ground Into Double Play
groupColumns.description: When a player hits a ground ball that results in more than one out on the bases.

groupColumns.label: Groundout to Air Out Ratio
groupColumns.description: A pitcher's ratio of groundouts to air outs.

groupColumns.label: Strikeouts per 9 IP
groupColumns.description: A pitcher's strikeout rate per 9 innings.

groupColumns.label: Walks per 9 IP
groupColumns.description: A pitcher's walk rate per 9 innings.

groupColumns.label: Strikeout to Walk Rate
groupColumns.description: A pitcher's ratio of strikeouts to walks.

groupColumns.label: Batting Average on Balls in Play
groupColumns.description: A measure of a pitcher's batting average against exclusively on balls hit into the field of play, removing outcomes not affected by the defense (namely home runs and strikeouts).

groupColumns.label: Stolen Bases Allowed
groupColumns.description: Total stolen bases while a pitcher is on the mound.

groupColumns.label: Caught Stealing
groupColumns.description: Total runners caught stealing a base while a pitcher is on the mound.

groupColumns.label: Pickoffs
groupColumns.description: When a pitcher throws a ball to a fielder, resulting in the putout of an opposing baserunner who had been leading off.

groupColumns.label: Wins
groupColumns.description: Credited to the pitcher whose team assumes a lead while such pitcher is in the game and does not relinquish such lead unless otherwise assigned by the official scorer.

groupColumns.label: Losses
groupColumns.description: Credited to the pitcher in the game when his team relinquishes — and never regains — the lead.

groupColumns.description: The average number of earned runs a pitcher allows per 9 innings.

dictionary.try_reloading: Try reloading the page. If the problem persists, please
dictionary.club_stats_seo_description: The official source for sortable {{fullClubName}} player and team stats, including customizable splits and filters.
dictionary.mlb_stats_seo_description: The official source for sortable MLB player and team stats, including customizable splits and filters.
dictionary.qualified_hitters: To qualify, a player must have 3.1 PA per team game played.
dictionary.qualified_pitchers: To qualify, a player must have 1.0 IP per team game.
dictionary.qualified_hitters_rookie: To qualify, a player must have 1.55 PA per team game played.
dictionary.qualified_pitchers_rookie: To qualify, a player must have 0.5 IP per team game.
dictionary.qualified_hitters_spring: To qualify, a player must have 1.86 PA per team game played. Stats accumulated during the July 2020 Summer Camp games are counted as part of Spring Training 2020.
dictionary.qualified_pitchers_spring: To qualify, a player must have 0.6 IP per team game. Stats accumulated during the July 2020 Summer Camp games are counted as part of Spring Training 2020.
dictionary.qualified_hitters_career: To qualify, a player must have 5,000 PA.
dictionary.qualified_pitchers_career: A retired player must have 2,000 IP to qualify. An active player must have 1,000 IP to qualify.
